Pre-Game Insights: Harry Tector could be a doubtful starter after injuring his thumb against India
It's an important game for both Canada and Ireland, who have suffered losses in their opening games
Canada hasn't been in great T20I form, having lost each of their last five T20Is
The Canada-Ireland fixture will likely take place on pitch no. 4, the same one that hosted the India-Ireland clash and the warm-up game between India and Bangladesh
Offspinner Nikhil Dutta went for 41 runs in 2.4 overs in Canada's opening game, so there is a chance they could bring in left-arm fast bowler Rishiv Joshi to boost their pace-bowling resources
If Harry Tector does not recover in time, Ireland might bring Ross Adair into the mix
Miscellaneous Highlights: Just two days after India rolled out Ireland for 96, Ireland managed to score 125 against Canada
Canada won by 12 runs in the 20th over
Mark Adair picked up the key wicket of Virat Kohli on Wednesday
Others: The fast bowlers have so far held sway here, having picked up 18 of the 26 wickets to fall while going at an economy rate of 5.46
The slow, sand-based outfield has also not helped the batters in any way
The temperature is likely to hover around the 29-degree (Celsius) mark and it's expected to be a little humid
Canada and Ireland have a 2-2 head-to-head record in T20Is, but haven't met since 2019
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar has an economy rate of 6.14 against right-hand batters in T20 cricket
Mark Adair is sixth on the wicket-taker's list in T20Is this year, with 18 in 10 games
